definition: twists and turns
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
wave/ripple/storm/surge
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

sentences.english: Greece has had a chequered history in the modern era.
sentences.chinese: 希臘的現代史是一段波折不斷的歷史。

sentences.english: And binding with briars my joys & desires.
sentences.chinese: 用波折綁縛着我的歡娛和慾望。

sentences.english: The Monkey King' is an extraordinary tale with a strange twist at the end.
sentences.chinese: 美猴王是個離奇的傳說，結尾有意想不到的波折。

sentences.english: Life seems to be a series of crises that have to be faced.
sentences.chinese: 人生就是要面對一連串的波折，哪怕我們不樂意。

sentences.english: Yong Qi and small swallow harvest love finally after many twists and turns.
sentences.chinese: 永琪和小燕子幾經波折最終收穫愛情。

sentences.english: There will be setbacks, and the world is headed for a stiff recession, at least.
sentences.chinese: 其間將會有波折，至少，世界正走向一場嚴重的衰退。

sentences.english: They have a vulnerable side to their personality, and can be easily hurt emotionally.
sentences.chinese: 個性上有柔弱的一面，感情易生波折。

sentences.english: Failure generates twists and turns to our lives, but it also spices our lives with great pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 失敗使生活波折，但是是生活增添情趣。

definition: bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
a torment/a trial/tribulation/a cross (to bear)/well-tried
calligraphic flourish with many twists/fig. many twists and turns
winding/(fig.) complicated
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)
everything is going smoothly/just as one wishes
untold dangers and difficulties (idiom)
experience/CL:個|个[ge4],次[ci4]/to experience/to go through
(of market prices etc) to rapidly fluctuate (idiom)/volatile/significant ups and downs/roller coaster
hardships/arduous/difficult
to thwart/to impede
dangerous and difficult (path)
bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
variable (math.)
